title: Spinach Stuffed Portobello Mushrooms with Avocado

Ingredients.2: 4  large portobello mushrooms, stems reserved and gills removed

Ingredients.3: 1 extra-virgin olive oil, or as needed

Ingredients.7: 1 large red bell pepper, cut into 1-inch pieces

Ingredients.11: 3 large avocados - peeled, pitted, and diced

Directions.1: Soak sun-dried tomatoes in a bowl of hot water until softened, about 20 minutes. Drain.

Directions.2: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).

Directions.3: Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.

Directions.4: Rub the caps of the portobello mushrooms with 2 tablespoons olive oil, or as needed; arrange mushrooms gill sides up on the prepared baking sheet. Season mushrooms with oregano, sea salt, and black pepper.

Directions.5: Bake mushrooms in the preheated oven until tender, 8 to 10 minutes.

Directions.6: Place the mushroom stems, sun-dried tomatoes, red bell pepper, and garlic cloves in a food processor; pulse until finely chopped.

Directions.7: Heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook and stir sun-dried tomato mixture in the hot oil until fragrant, about 2 minutes.

Directions.8: Stir spinach into the skillet; cover, reduce heat to medium-low, and cook until spinach is wilted, about 3 minutes more, stirring occasionally. Drain excess liquid from skillet.

Directions.9: Spoon spinach mixture over baked mushroom caps.

Directions.10: Divide diced avocado atop stuff mushrooms and sprinkle with Parmesan cheese to serve.
